intro: Hieracium villarsii, commonly known as the Villars' hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium villarsii is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
